Here are highlights of a special interaction PM @narendramodi had with Chief Secretaries of States & UTs. https://t.co/UuoSpVlsMq
Chief Secretaries presented best practices in their states in key areas including rural development, agriculture, health, tribal welfare.
Presentations were also shared on Divyang welfare, solid waste management, e-governance, PDS reform among various other policy issues.
In his address, PM highlighted the importance of ‘competitive cooperative federalism’ & need to learn from best practices of various states
PM spoke about Central Government’s focus on ease of doing business & bringing greater investment in the states, which would benefit people.
PM also called for greater usage of technology in areas of governance. Technology has a transformative potential on the lives of citizens.
Good governance is the greatest key to the success of government programmes & development goals. https://t.co/UuoSpVlsMq

Speech in the plenum of the House, on the developments in the negotiations on the Cyprus issue. https://t.co/xFNKqw3git
A just and viable solution to the Cyprus problem is a national goal. Dialogue and national conciliation are extremely important.
The Greek government - the Greek delegation - has maintained throughout the negotiation, the standing positions of our country.
A just and sustainable solution can only be achieved on the basis of the decisions of the SA. the UN and the status of Cyprus as a member of the EU.
# Momani: Edit # Mosul strategic victory in the war on terrorism https://t.co/btw2owhI5G
Greece supports Cyprus' efforts in bi-communal talks but is involved only in the negotiation of the security chapter.
A just and viable solution to the Cyprus problem means removing the consequences of the invasion and occupation of part of Cyprus. (1/2)
It involves the abolition of invasive rights and guarantees and the withdrawal of occupying troops. (2/2)
A reunited Cyprus under a guarantee scheme could never express itself in an independent voice at Community level. 1/2
The presence of occupying troops in reunited Cyprus would undermine any effort for peace and reconciliation on the island. 2/2
For over a year, we have tabled a series of proposals, including the conclusion of a Tripartite Friendship Agreement and the establishment of a UN-Control Mechanism. 1/2
Ensuring that past mistakes will not be repeated and that "community security will not be built at the expense of the other" .2 / 2
The cooperation between Greece and the Republic of Cyprus is and will continue to be a critical axis of Greek foreign policy. 1/2
This is of course the support of Kypros. Republic in the exercise of its sovereign rights in its Exclusive Economic Zone. 2/2
